TextView.android:text: 0-4 Months:Breast milk or formula: Babies should be exclusively fed breast milk or formula for the first 4-6 months. Iron supplements: Around 4 months, iron supplements are often recommended, especially for breastfed babies as their iron stores begin to deplete.

4-6 Months:
Introduction of solids: Begin introducing solid foods around 4-6 months. Start with single-grain infant cereals, pureed fruits, and vegetables. Iron-rich foods: Incorporate iron-rich foods like infant cereals, pureed meats, and beans. Continue breast milk or formula: Continue to offer breast milk or formula as the primary source of nutrition.

6-8 Months:
More variety: Introduce a wider variety of pureed or mashed fruits and vegetables. Soft finger foods: Offer small, soft pieces of food that the baby can pick up and eat, such as well-cooked vegetables, small pieces of fruit, and soft cheese. Continue breast milk or formula: Maintain breast milk or formula feedings alongside solids.
